data.title: Pizza 73 Franchise News
data.meta_description: The latest company news for Pizza 73. Browse our collection of press announcements regarding corporate finance, annual reports, franchise expansion, product announcements, and corporate executives and executive boards at Franchising.com.
data.text:
Browse the latest corporate news from Pizza 73.

From April 23 to May 13, Pizza 73 is offering customers a 9-inch pepperoni Smile Pizza for $5.50 as part of its Slices for Smiles campaign with a portion of proceeds going to local children’s hospitals through Children’s Miracle Network...

Pizza 73 has opened its first location in Prince Albert located at 3300 - 2nd Avenue West, in the South side of town. This is the chain’s fifth location in Saskatchewan and 84th in total.

Hot and fresh pizzas topped with pepperoni smiles are back on the menu at Pizza 73 as part of their annual Slices for Smiles fundraising program.

Pizza 73 announces the recent opening of three new locations in Alberta. The first opened in May at 16236 Ellerslie Road SW in Edmonton - the 35th Pizza 73 location in the Greater Edmonton Area.

Pizza topped with a pepperoni smile is on the menu at Pizza 73 this month.

Pizza 73, Western Canada’s leading pizza chain, continues to expand in Alberta with the recent opening of two new stores in the Calgary area.

Pizza 73 is looking to become a triple threat. The company is famous for its pizzas made from fresh dough daily in-store and its golden crispy chicken wings, and is now adding oven-baked pastas to its arsenal.

Pizza 73, Western Canada’s leading pizza chain, has announced a special offer with Calgary Flames left winger Johnny Hockey Gaudreau.

Seasoned dry ribs and new sesame seed pizza crust highlight the 2016 summer menu for Pizza 73, Western Canada’s leading pizza chain.

Pizza 73 is offering customers a tasty, easy and cheesy way to support children’s hospitals in Western Canada.

A Leger poll conducted from January 18 to January 21 confirms that pizza is the preferred food choice for Canadians who are planning to watch the Super Bowl at a private residence.

Pizza 73, the leading pizza chain in Western Canada, keeps growing and growing with the opening of two new locations in Edmonton. The expansion tops off the 30th anniversary of Pizza 73 this year and brings its store count to 103.

The Pizza 73 team will be bringing smiles back, that is their “Smile Pizzas,” as it tosses up some pizzas to celebrate National Pizza Month and the return of its annual Slices for Smiles fundraiser.

The Pizza 73 team has two big reasons to smile this April. The company continues to celebrate its 30th anniversary and is kicking off its 2015 fundraising efforts for the Slices for Smiles Foundation.

Pizza 73 invites hungry Canadians to visit any of its traditional stores from April 26 to May 2 to benefit from a special offer in support of Slices for Smiles, a program devoted to children's charities. The campaign will direct funding toward...

To celebrate National Pizza Month, Pizza 73 will be bringing the fun of pizza to kids through fun for the community, fundraisers for children and onli ne contests.

Partners in life and business, Surbhi and Raj Parashar have been eagerly anticipating the day when they could open the doors to their very own Pizza 73 restaurant. Today, their wait is over.

Page 1 of 1 ^ Return to Top 1

This web page does not constitute a franchise offering or an offer to sell a franchise. A franchise offering can be made by us only in a state if we are first registered, excluded, exempted or otherwise qualified to offer franchises in that state, and only if we provide you with an appropriate franchise disclosure document.
